publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4764 Chris Ballance: Scotland’s China Office—That the Parliament notes the launch of the Scottish Executive’s Scotland’s strategy for stronger engagement with China and the signing of the Co-operation Agreement with Shandong Province in China; praises Amnesty International for raising concerns relating to human rights in Shandong Province, and urges the Executive to set standards by which companies should engage with China, to challenge abuses of human rights and to use the opportunity of greater ties with the Shandong Province to call for the release of Chen Guangcheng and for an end to forced abortions and sterilisations in the province.

S2M-4764 Chris Ballance: Scotland’s China Office—That the Parliament notes the launch of the Scottish Executive’s Scotland’s strategy for stronger engagement with China and the signing of the Co-operation Agreement with Shandong Province in China; praises Amnesty International for raising concerns relating to human rights in Shandong Province, and urges the Executive to set standards by which companies should engage with China, to challenge abuses of human rights and to use the opportunity of greater ties with the Shandong Province to call for the release of Chen Guangcheng and for an end to forced abortions and sterilisations in the province. Supported by: Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, Mark Ballard*, Mike Pringle*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-4764 Scotland’s China Office (lodged on 7 September 2006) Tommy Sheridan*, Robin Harper*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-4764 Scotland’s China Office (lodged on 7 September 2006) Murdo Fraser*, Donald Gorrie*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-4764 Scotland’s China Office (lodged on 7 September 2006) Mr Mark Ruskell*
S2M-4764 Scotland’s China Office (lodged on 7 September 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
